<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch7="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:sch6="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0" xmlns:sch5="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:sch4="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch3="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0" xmlns:sch2="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:sch1="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:sch0="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:ws:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:standingorder="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:standingorder:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The StandingOrder services can return ErrorCodes defined in the StandingOrder domain, which is described in this document. However since StandingOrder uses PaymentInitiation for validation of payment data, ErrorCodes from this domain can also be returned. These ErrorCodes are defined in the html documentation for the PIN Services PINSPayment_V1_5.html. The most common are listed below: Common error codes: 0 - OK 12 - Not found 13 - Duplicate entry (e.g. standingOrder already exists) 69 - User not authorized 70 - technical error 6000 - Validation error 6485 - Not authorized for accounts</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import namespace="urn:srv.stord.fs.evry.com:domain:standingorder:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderStatusUpdateRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set status of the SO given by the SO key to the status given Error Codes (Standing Order Error codes starts from 7000 series): 7020 - Invalid agreement key. 7023 - Invalid agreement key, the id part is invalid. 7024 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is invalid. 7025 - Invalid status change type. 7026 - Invalid state change. 7027 - Invalid Days before due date. 7035 - Agreement is already approved by the user. 7050 - Unable to find any Standing Order Agreement that matches the search criteria. 7051 - Search result too large, unable to choose a unique agreement with the given search criteria. 7105 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is Not Found. 7117 - Standing Order, delete iHub agreement failed. 7118 - Standing Order, create iHub agreement failed. 7119 - Standing order status update failed. 7123 - The debtor agent bic and debtor account bic are not same. 7125 - Agreement is already verified by the user.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrderKey" type="standingorder:standingOrderKey"/> <xs:element name="standingOrderAction" type="standingorder:standingOrderActionEnum"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderStatusUpdateResponse"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="standingOrderStatus" type="standingorder:standingOrderStatusEnum"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderVerifySearchRequest"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrderVerifySearch" type="tns:standingOrderVerifySearch"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderVerifySearch"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Search criteria for searching the Pending Verification Standing Order Agreements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="verifySearchCriteria" type="standingorder:verifySearchCriteria"/> <xs:element name="pagingElement" type="cm:pagingInputElementType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderVerifySearchResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Response from searching standingOrders for Verify. If none found an empty list is returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="standingOrders" type="standingorder:standingOrderVerifySearchType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="elementControl" type="cm:ElementControlOut"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderSearchRequest"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrderSearch" type="tns:standingOrderSearch"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderSearch"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Search criteria for searching the Standing Order Agreements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="searchCriteria" type="standingorder:searchCriteria"/> <xs:element name="pagingElement" type="cm:pagingInputElementType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderSearchResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Response from searching standingOrders. If none found an empty list is returned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="standingOrders" type="standingorder:standingOrderSearchType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="elementControl" type="cm:ElementControlOut"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderCreateRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Create a new distinct standingOrder. Error Codes (Standing Order Error codes starts from 7000 series) : 6440 - Creditor agent country code missing. 7002 - Agreement end date cannot be a past date or current date. 7004 - Agreement end date should be after first due date. 7005 - End date should be after second due date. 7009 - Exemption end date should be same or after exemption start date. 7010 - Exemption range should be within the agreement range. 7011 - Cannot have duplicate exemptions. 7012 - Given Recurrence not defined in PBD. 7013 - Agreement should have first due date. 7014 - Semi-Monthly recurrence should have second due date. 7015 - Second due date should be last day or second last day of the month. 7016 - First due date should be last day or second last day of the previous month of Second due date. 7017 - One of the First or Second due date should be 15th of a month. 7022 - Unknown Trigger Type. 7028 - No interval will be created because the agreement is not active during proposed interval. 7029 - Invalid Standing Order Agreement Status. 7034 - Second Due Date is applicable only for Recurrence SEMI-MONTHLY. 7043 - The percent value is below zero. 7055 - Credit account not set for split. 7056 - Credit account for split does not exist in transaction list. 7057 - The number of splits is invalid for corresponding trigger type. 7062 - One of amount or percent must be set for a split. 7063 - Percentage is not applicable for the limit type BELOW. 7064 - Given Purpose Code does not exist in PBD. 7065 - The calculated amount to transfer is less than the minimum amount allowed. 7066 - Invalid denominator. 7069 - Recurrence not found. 7070 - Exemption start or end date not found. 7073 - Splits not found. 7074 - Balance trigger fields not found. 7075 - Balance trigger limit type not found. 7078 - Balance trigger limit amount not found. 7079 - Purpose not found. 7080 - Incoming transaction can't cover all external splits. 7081 - External trigger service accessed with illegal amount of transactions. 7082 - The percentage given for splits is over hundred. 7085 - The given trigger type is not available for current user. 7087 - Exemption with yearly recurrence has a period that is longer or equal to a year. 7089 - Invalid Amount, Amount cannot be zero. 7090 - Invalid Amount, Amount should be based on ISO Code – 18,5. 7093 - Currency Code not found. 7094 - Agreement exists with same PURPOSE and DEBIT account. 7095 - The debtor account is not in producing bank. 7096 - The creditor account is not in producing bank. 7097 - The number of splits for balance agreement should be one. 7099 - A external trigger transaction must be domestic. 7100 - Debtor agent country is not found. 7101 - Balance trigger is not applicable. 7102 - Splits are not required for Periodic agreements. 7103 - User Segment Type Not found. 7104 - Second due date is equal to end date and is a bank holiday, Please adjust the agreement end date. 7105 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is Not Found. 7106 - Purpose/Text Code/Category Purpose should not be null. 7107 - Purpose is not applicable. 7108 - Transaction amount cannot be null for Periodic agreements. 7109 - Recurrence is not applicable for External agreements. 7110 - Bank Holiday Adjustment is not applicable for External agreements. 7111 - Agreement with Recurrence Semi Monthly, cannot have more than two Due Dates. 7112 - Agreement exists with same limit type and account. 7113 - Transaction cannot have PaymentTypeCode. 7114 - Agreement cannot be created with same credit and debit account numbers. 7115 - Balance Agreements cannot have more than one transactions. 7116 - Debtor account is missing 7120 - The debtor agent bic is mandatory for foreign account 7121 - Standing Order has Domestic payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7122 - Standing Order has International payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7123 - The debtor agent bic and debtor account bic are not same. 7126 - Balance Above cannot have Split Amount greater than Limit Amount. 7127 - Balance Below cannot have Split Amount lesser than Limit Amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrder" type="standingorder:standingOrderCreateType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderCreateResponse"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="cm:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="standingOrderKey" type="standingorder:standingOrderKey"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The standingOrderKey to the newly created standingOrder - given that the service was able to succeed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="futureTransactions" type="standingorder:transaction"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="standingOrderUpdateRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Update a new standingOrder. This will cause the creation of a new SO with the same agreementReferenceNumber and a new agreementVersionNumber Error Codes (Standing Order Error codes starts from 7000 series) : 7020 - Invalid agreement key. 7023 - Invalid agreement key, the id part is invalid. 7024 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is invalid. 7031 - Standing Order Update not allowed for Status CLOSED, PENDING_CLOSE. 7032 - Standing Order Type, does not match. 7050 - Unable to find any Standing Order Agreement that matches the search criteria. 7051 - Search result too large, unable to choose a unique agreement with the given search criteria. 7098 - Unable to resolve new first due date. 7105 - Invalid agreement key, the version part is Not Found. 7107 - Purpose is not applicable. 7108 - Transaction amount cannot be null for Periodic agreements. 7111 - Agreement with Recurrence Semi Monthly, cannot have more than two Due Dates. 7112 - Agreement exists with same limit type and account. 7113 - Transaction cannot have PaymentTypeCode. 7114 - Agreement cannot be created with same credit and debit account numbers. 7115 - Balance Agreements cannot have more than one transactions. 7116 - Debtor account is missing 7120 - The debtor agent bic is missing 7121 - Standing Order has Domestic payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7122 - Standing Order has International payments, User doesnt have EAM permission. 7123 - The debtor agent bic and debtor account bic are not same. 7124 - Employee is not authorised to perform requested operation. 7126 - Balance Above cannot have Split Amount greater than Limit Amount. 7127 - Balance Below cannot have Split Amount lesser than Limit Amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="standingOrder" type="standingorder:standingOrderUpdateType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:element name="standingOrderCreateRequest" type="tns:standingOrderCreateRequest"/> <xs:element name="ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DEBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SLEV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeInfoTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TOTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TOTA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in the transfer currency deducted from the transfer amount. Pertains only to outgoing payments where charges on the sender side are to be borne by the beneficiary.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 1 = Debited account separately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO2"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 2 = Accumulated and debited/invoiced at intervals.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO3"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 3 = Fees deducted from transferred amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PriorityCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> The transaction will be reserved on both the debitor and creditor and completed immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EINV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice - EVRY proprietary code. <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="cm:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="cm:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="cm:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cm:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="proprietaryCode" type="cm:Max8Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>non-ISO-20022: "This field can be used for other codeWords/instructions for other payment standards (ISO-15022, etc.). This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="cm:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. See also initiatorIdentifier that is the id of the party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eInvoiceType" type="st:EinvoiceType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The type of eInvoice, based on from where it comes from.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to identify the documents referred to in the remittance information." Typical use: invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:ReferredDocumentType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of referred document." Values: CINV, CREN Default: CINV</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the issuer of the reference document type"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="number" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous identification of the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="relatedDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date associated with the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="invoiceeOtherId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the party to whom an invoice is issued, when it is different from the debtor or ultimate debtor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationStructured" type="tns:RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="tns:ReferredDocumentInformation"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentAmount" type="tns:ReferredDocumentAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorReferenceInformation" type="tns:CreditorReferenceInformation"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="3" minOccurs="0" name="additionalRemittanceInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides details on the amounts of the referred document.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="duePayableAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified is the exact amount due and payable to the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditNoteAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditorReferenceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:CreditorReferenceInformationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type of creditor reference, in a coded form Values: DISP, FXDR, PUOR, RADM, RPIN, SCOR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Entity that assigns the credit reference type</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="reference" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
